item.title: Warren Shea
item.long-description:
A resume / online portfolio that showcases the professional milestones and abilities of Warren Shea. It heavily utilizes code techniques such as AJAX and XML and was built to take advantage of HTML5, CSS3, and jQuery.

HTTP requests are kept at a minumum. There is only 1 CSS file and 1 JavaScript file loaded. The CSS is loaded at the top of the page and the JavaScript is loaded at the bottom. Common images are often in CSS Sprites to minimize requests.

This site most accurately highlights my current front-end development skills in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

item.title: BMO Capital Markets
item.long-description:
Acted as both Technical Advisor and Senior Lead Developer on this 18-month project required to migrate code from a legacy server running ASP Classic VB and SQL Server 2005 to a new server running ASP.NET 4.0 and SQL Server 2008.

During the migration, the front-end code was updated to use aspects of HTML5 and CSS3. Also, registration forms built using ASP Classic VB were updated to use ASP.NET and prevent against SQL Injection.

The code is clean and well formatted. The site uses leading double slash paths for both HTTP and HTTPS protocol, disables compatibility mode for IE7 and IE8, and uses GIF alternatives and IE6 CSS hacks for alpha transparent PNGs.

development

item.title: BMO Guardian Funds
item.long-description:
This project consisted of taking a mockup and reskinning the current Guardian Funds site with minimal changes to the code.

Difficulties in this project arose because the code was managed by a different group. A one-page site with the incorporated design was created on our servers and the code was sent to the other development team to implement the changes on their end. The site was also built around a custom grown content management system so the front-end changes had to fit around that existing code. In the end, the project was successful and the code was substantially cleaned up and improved.
item.info:
development

current status
completed 2011

url
www.bmoguardianfunds.com

item.title: Web Accessibility Guide
item.long-description:
Last year, there was a 6-month project to bring BMO.com up to Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0 Level AA standards. Acting as Developer Lead, Team Lead, and Project Manager, I managed a small team of 4 to bring thousands of web pages up to this standard.

This document was created as a Web Accessibility Cheat Sheet that other web developers on my team used to make their front-end code conform to the WCAG 2.0 Level AA standard.
item.info:
guides & documents

guideline used
WCAG 2.0 Level A, AA, AAA

front-end skills used
HTML5
XHTML 1.0

item.title: BMO Podcast
item.long-description:
A centralized podcast site for most of the podcasts on BMO.com.

There is a jQuery Accordion menu and all the Podcast changes are done with XML, RSS2.0 and AJAX. The rating system is built using AJAX calls and JSON notation. The podcasts, in mp3 format, play through an internally built Flash player.
